name: degree
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: This job demands a high degree of skill.
example.egtrans: 这项工作对技术的要求很高。

example.eg: There isn't the slightest degree of doubt that he's innocent.
I have to warn you that there's a degree of (= some) danger involved in this.
example.egtrans: 我必须警告你这里面有一定的危险。

example.eg: The number of terrorist attacks has increased to a terrifying degree.
example.egtrans: 恐怖袭击的次数已经到了骇人的程度。

example.eg: There was some degree of truth in what she said.
example.egtrans: 她说的有一定的真实性。

example.eg: To what degree do you think we will be providing a better service?
example.egtrans: 你认为我们的服务还有多大的改进空间？

example.eg: "That's really bad." "Well, it's all a matter/question of degree (= there are other things better and other things worse)."
example.egtrans: “那可真是太糟糕了。”“只是程度不同而已。”

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any of various units of measurement, especially of temperature or angles, usually shown by the symbol ° written after a number
trans_examp.trans_cn: 度，度数（尤指温度或角度的度量单位，通常在数字后用符号°来表示）

example.eg: Water boils at 212° Fahrenheit and 100° Celsius/Centigrade.
example.egtrans: 水在212华氏度，即100摄氏度沸腾。

example.eg: A right angle is an angle of 90°.
New York is on a latitude of 41°N and a longitude of 74°W.
example.egtrans: 纽约位于北纬41度、西经74度。

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a course of study at a college or university, or the qualification given to a student after he or she has completed his or her studies

example.eg: She has a physics degree/a degree in physics from Edinburgh.
example.egtrans: 她获得了爱丁堡大学的物理学学位。

example.eg: She has a bachelor's/master's degree in history from Yale.
example.egtrans: 她获得了耶鲁大学历史学专业的学士／硕士学位。

example.eg: "What degree did you do at York?" "Geography."
example.egtrans: “你在约克大学学的什么课程？”“地理学。”

name: -degree
posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used with an ordinal number to show how serious something is
trans_examp.trans_cn: …度，…级（与序数词并用，表示某事物的严重性）

example.eg: She suffered first-/second-/third-degree (= least serious/serious/very serious) burns on her legs.
example.egtrans: 她的腿部受到一度／二度／三度烧伤。

example.eg: He's being charged with first-degree (= the most serious type of) murder.
example.egtrans: 他被指控犯有一级谋杀罪。
